article_text:
One of the big questions out of the IRS targeting scandal is this: How can an agency that engaged in such political misconduct be trusted to implement ObamaCare? This week's Halbig v. Burwell ruling reminded us of the answer. It can't.

The D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals ruled in Halbig that the administration had illegally provided ObamaCare subsidies in 36 insurance exchanges run by the federal government. Yet it wasn't the...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, Potomac Watch columnist Kimberley Strassel writes that the supposedly independent agency harassed the administration's political opponents and saved its health-care law.
twitter.title: The ObamaCare-IRS Nexus
